description: The label of the radio group.

type: default | primary | secondary | success | warning | danger

description: The orientation of the radio group.
The name of the RadioGroup, used when submitting an HTML form. See [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/input#name_and_radio_buttons).

Validate input values when committing (e.g. on blur), returning error messages for invalid values. Validation errors are displayed upon form submission if `validationBehavior` is set to `native`. For real-time validation, use the `isInvalid` prop.
Whether to use native HTML form validation or ARIA validation. When wrapped in a Form component, the default is `aria`. Otherwise, the default is `native`.
Whether the radio group is disabled.
Whether user checkboxes are required on the input before form submission.
Whether the checkboxes can be selected but not changed by the user.
Whether the radio group is invalid.
Whether the inputs should display its "valid" or "invalid" visual styling. (Deprecated) use isInvalid instead.
Whether the animation should be disabled.
Allows to set custom class names for the radio group slots.
